result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Gauthier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. (fine/costs have been paid in full)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J Gauthier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant has successfuly complied with terms of his DAGPA and has prepaid $100 fine plus costs. State moves to amend charge to a County Ordinance of Disorderly Conduct. Court approves request, judgment entered to amended charge. Bond is no longer in effect.
from Atty Reetz requesting 3 month extension for defendant to pay remaining fine/costs. State would like explanation as to why defendant hasn't paid on time. File.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on June 19, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Final court appointed atty bill from Atty Brett Reetz. Court approves bill.
Court amends bond from no contact to no violent contact with N.M.B. and G.E.B.
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement

Defendant Andrew J Gauthier in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily but withholds accepting of the plea to allow defendant time to complete terms of the Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement.   Court dismisses Cts. 1 & 3 but reads in for sentencing.  Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties if defendant would be convicted of a felony. Court reviews DAGPA with defendant, approves and signs agreement. Upon successful completion of DAGPA, State will, after 18 months, move to amend the charge to a county ordinance of disorderly conduct and matter can be disposed by written stipulation. Bond remains in effect.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 26, 2017 at 11:45 am.
from Atty Reetz requesting to reschedule because of a conflict. Court reschedules.
Status conference at 12-21-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Andrew J Gauthier in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz indicates matter is not resolved yet, asks court to set matter for pretrial and trial. Discussion regarding setting matter for pretrial/trial or another status. Atty Reetz requests another status, if talks break down, will notify the court to set matter for pretrial and trial. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.
from Atty Reetz advising of a new employer for Mr. Gauthier. Defendnat is employed through Task Management, an employment agency, and is currently working for Pepperidge Farm.

Defendant Andrew J Gauthier in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz requests 30-45 day adjournment to try and resolve matter with the State. State not opposed to adjournment. Court commends defendant for being up to date on his attorney fee payment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Andrew J Gauthier in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  Atty Reetz just received discovery, requests some time to talk to the State to try and resolve matter. Court commends defendant on payment of atty fees, must continue with those monthly payments. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.
State's Discovery Demand
Contract for Repayment of Court-appointed Attorney Fees
Assuming the Information mirrors the Criminal Complaint, Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is. Status scheduled for 7/24/15 at 1:30 PM.

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  State will file the Information later today.

Defendant Andrew J Gauthier in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant on his petition for appointment of counsel form. Defendant asks court to appoint an attorney from Door County. Defendant to talk to Atty Reetz and return. Defendant and Atty Reetz back in court. Defendant asks court to appoint court to appoint Atty Reetz to represent him. Court appoints Atty Brett to represent defendant. Defendant to pay $75 per month toward atty fees. First payment due by 7/15/15. Defense waives reading of the complaint.
hold till 6/22/15 hearing, will address then. DTE
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: No contact direct or indirect with N.M.D., dob 5/02/98 and G.E.B., dob 8/10/05.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Andrew J Gauthier appears by video conference.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 6/09/15 by jail staff.
